content.question: Which of the following gives the length of the curve defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, the sine squared of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the cosine squared of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, 8 times the sine squared of t, times the cosine squared of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>8</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, the square root of 8 times the sine squared of t, times the cosine squared of t, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><msqrt><mrow><mn>8</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, the square root of the sine to the fourth power of t, plus the cosine to the fourth power of t, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, the square root of 4 times the sine squared of t, plus 4 times the cosine squared of t, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, the square root of 8 times the sine squared of t, times the cosine squared of t, end root, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><msqrt><mrow><mn>8</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.3: (BC ONLY) Finding Arc Lengths of Curves Given by Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
